talk.author: did:plc:nzmci5jwjwysdqr4o3f4eg6d
talk.utter: There is polling to say that drivers don’t see cyclists as human and I regularly see violent rhetoric from motorists about cyclists, there are definitely huge blind spots to people who have no choice but to drive from them though.

talk.author: did:plc:g6asx7scljsgdu3vqwtyfszj
talk.utter: Oh I’ve seen so much violent rhetoric about cyclists. It’s a big problem. The solution isn’t to decide that cars are inherently a moral hazard tho

talk.author: did:plc:nzmci5jwjwysdqr4o3f4eg6d
talk.utter: Yeah as someone who cycles I kind of get the mindset a little bit it does feel like motorists are trying to murder me but the arguments really should be to give everyone as many options as possible. If you make it safe and accessible more people will cycle without you having to crap all over drivers

talk.author: did:plc:nzmci5jwjwysdqr4o3f4eg6d
talk.utter: Yeah as someone who cycles I kind of get the mindset a little bit it does feel like motorists are trying to murder me but the arguments really should be to give everyone as many options as possible. If you make it safe and accessible more people will cycle without you having to crap all over drivers

talk.author: did:plc:5dokrqnikwh5egun7yfivvi2
talk.utter: And yes, protected bike lanes for all, but in the meantime?

talk.author: did:plc:nzmci5jwjwysdqr4o3f4eg6d
talk.utter: Personally I think everyone who can should walk and cycle a little just to see what it’s like and they’d understand better. Maybe driver education programs would help? Hard to make progress without getting local communities on board.
